de.uni.bamberg.wiai.minf.forflow.datagenerator.model.datastructure
Class MetaClass

java.lang.Object
  de.uni.bamberg.wiai.minf.forflow.datagenerator.model.datastructure.MetaClass

public class MetaClass
extends java.lang.Object

MetaClass represents the Ecore's EClass. A class has one or more attributes, which are represented in MetaAttribute. That means each attribute is itself a class. The advantage of this approach is that additional informations can be stored to each attribute without affecting others. So each attribute can independently be tuned.

This class provides only the default constructor. This is, because the values must be set explicit with its corresponding methods.

Since:
Apr/07/09
Version:
0.1
Author:
Michael Munz

public MetaAttribute getAttribute(java.lang.String name)
tries to find an attribute by a given name. If there exists one with that name it's returned, otherwise null.

deleteAttribute

public boolean deleteAttribute(MetaAttribute mAttribute)
removes an attribute from an meta class. Notice, once an attribute is removed from the data structure, it is impossible to restore it.

Parameters:
mAttribute - attribute to delete
Returns:
true, if successfully deleted

deleteAttribute

public boolean deleteAttribute(java.lang.String name)
removes an attribute from this meta class by a given name. The data structure is searched through and if it was found it's removed. And to indicate this, true is returned. Otherwise false. Once it has been removed there's no way back.

Parameters:
name - attribute to delete
Returns:
true, if successfully deleted

setToConcreteSpec

public void setToConcreteSpec()
sets the flag of this class to concrete specification. It indicates that this class is a leaf in UML diagram.

Example:

                         Artefact
                         /      \
                        /        \
                     Product   Document
                     /    \     /    \
                    /      \   /      \
                 Screw    Nut CAD    ScopeOfStatement
                  /
             SquareHeadBold
In the above example are those concrete specifications in bold characters, that is a leaf in terms of a tree.

isConcreteSpec

public boolean isConcreteSpec()
indicates, whether it is a concrete specification of an abstract term of classification.

Returns:
true, if and only if this class is a concrete term.

true, if a base class exists

setQuantity

public void setQuantity(int quantitiy)
determines the amount of test data to generate for this class. Only concrete terms can have this attitude.

Parameters:
quantitiy - number of test sets to generate

getQuantity

public final int getQuantity()
the amount of test data sets to generate for this meta class. Only concrete terms can have a quantity greater than 0.

Returns:
how many test sets are gonna be generated?

equals

public boolean equals(java.lang.Object ob)
               throws java.lang.ClassCastException
Two meta classes are said to be equal, if there names are the same. This is because in an UML diagram can only one class with a given name exist at a time. Otherwise it would be ambiguous.

Overrides:
equals in class java.lang.Object
Throws:
java.lang.ClassCastException
